definition[0]: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
example[1]: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
definition[1]: if a gas or liquid leaks somewhere, it gets through a hole in something
example[2]: Sea water was leaking into the batteries which powered the electric motors.
definition[2]: to deliberately give secret information to a newspaper, television company etc
example[3]: The reportâ€™s findings had been leaked.
example[4]: civil servants who leak information to the press
definition[3]: a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something
example[5]: There is a leak in the ceiling.
example[6]: The boat had sprung a leak  (=a hole had appeared in it).
definition[4]: a situation in which secret information is deliberately given to a newspaper, television company etc
example[7]: It became evident from the leaks that something important was going on.
